   16315             :              * it breaks our pg_upgrade strategy, but it also makes sense on
   16316             :              * its own: if a child has its own not-null constraint and then
   16317             :              * acquires a parent with the same constraint, then we start to

   16394             : /*
   16395             :  * ALTER TABLE NO INHERIT
   16396             :  *
   16397             :  * Return value is the address of the relation that is no longer parent.
   16398             :  */
   16399             : static ObjectAddress
   16400          44 : ATExecDropInherit(Relation rel, RangeVar *parent, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   16401             : {
   16402             :     ObjectAddress address;
   16403             :     Relation    parent_rel;
   16404             : 
   16405          44 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relispartition)
   16406           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   16407             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   16408             :                  errmsg("cannot change inheritance of a partition")));
   16409             : 
   16410             :     /*
   16411             :      * AccessShareLock on the parent is probably enough, seeing that DROP
   16412             :      * TABLE doesn't lock parent tables at all.  We need some lock since we'll
   16413             :      * be inspecting the parent's schema.
   16414             :      */
   16415          44 :     parent_rel = table_openrv(parent, AccessShareLock);
   16416             : 
   16417             :     /*
   16418             :      * We don't bother to check ownership of the parent table --- ownership of
   16419             :      * the child is presumed enough rights.
   16420             :      */
   16421             : 
   16422             :     /* Off to RemoveInheritance() where most of the work happens */
   16423          44 :     RemoveInheritance(rel, parent_rel, false);
   16424             : 
   16425             :     /*
   16426             :      * If parent_rel has a primary key, then child_rel has not-null
   16427             :      * constraints that make these columns as non nullable.  Mark those
   16428             :      * constraints as no longer inherited by this parent.
   16429             :      */
   16430          38 :     ATInheritAdjustNotNulls(parent_rel, rel, -1);
   16431             :

   16434             :      * NULL constraints

   16437          38 :     ObjectAddressSet(address, RelationRelationId,
   16438             :                      RelationGetRelid(parent_rel));
   16439             : 
   16440             :     /* keep our lock on the parent relation until commit */
   16441          38 :     table_close(parent_rel, NoLock);
   16442             : 
   16443          38 :     return address;
   16444             : }
   16445             : 
   16446             : /*
   16447             :  * MarkInheritDetached
   16448             :  *
   16449             :  * Set inhdetachpending for a partition, for ATExecDetachPartition
   16450             :  * in concurrent mode.  While at it, verify that no other partition is
   16451             :  * already pending detach.
   16452             :  */
   16453             : static void
   16454         146 : MarkInheritDetached(Relation child_rel, Relation parent_rel)
   16455             : {

   16458             :     ScanKeyData key;

   16461             : 
   16462         146 :     Assert(parent_rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE);
   16463             : 
   16464             :     /*
   16465             :      * Find pg_inherits entries by inhparent.  (We need to scan them all in

   16517             : 
   16518             : /*
   16519             :  * RemoveInheritance
   16520             :  *
   16521             :  * Drop a parent from the child's parents. This just adjusts the attinhcount
   16522             :  * and attislocal of the columns and removes the pg_inherit and pg_depend
   16523             :  * entries.  expect_detached is passed down to DeleteInheritsTuple, q.v..
   16524             :  *
   16525             :  * If attinhcount goes to 0 then attislocal gets set to true. If it goes back
   16526             :  * up attislocal stays true, which means if a child is ever removed from a
   16527             :  * parent then its columns will never be automatically dropped which may
   16528             :  * surprise. But at least we'll never surprise by dropping columns someone
   16529             :  * isn't expecting to be dropped which would actually mean data loss.
   16530             :  *
   16531             :  * coninhcount and conislocal for inherited constraints are adjusted in
   16532             :  * exactly the same way.
   16533             :  *
   16534             :  * Common to ATExecDropInherit() and ATExecDetachPartition().
   16535             :  */
   16536             : static void
   16537         488 : RemoveInheritance(Relation child_rel, Relation parent_rel, bool expect_detached)
   16538             : {
   16539             :     Relation    catalogRelation;
   16540             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   16541             :     ScanKeyData key[3];
   16542             :     HeapTuple   attributeTuple,
   16543             :                 constraintTuple;
   16544             :     List       *connames;
   16545             :     List       *nncolumns;
   16546             :     bool        found;
   16547             :     bool        is_partitioning;
   16548             : 
   16549         488 :     is_partitioning = (parent_rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE);
   16550             : 
   16551         488 :     found = DeleteInheritsTuple(RelationGetRelid(child_rel),
   16552             :                                 RelationGetRelid(parent_rel),
   16553             :                                 expect_detached,
   16554         488 :                                 RelationGetRelationName(child_rel));
   16555         488 :     if (!found)
   16556             :     {
   16557          24 :         if (is_partitioning)
   16558          18 :             ereport(ERROR,
   16559             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_UNDEFINED_TABLE),
   16560             :                      errmsg("relation \"%s\" is not a partition of relation \"%s\"",
   16561             :                             RelationGetRelationName(child_rel),
   16562             :                             RelationGetRelationName(parent_rel))));
   16563             :         else
   16564           6 :             ereport(ERROR,
   16565             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_UNDEFINED_TABLE),
   16566             :                      errmsg("relation \"%s\" is not a parent of relation \"%s\"",
   16567             :                             RelationGetRelationName(parent_rel),
   16568             :                             RelationGetRelationName(child_rel))));
   16569             :     }
   16570             : 
   16571             :     /*
   16572             :      * Search through child columns looking for ones matching parent rel
   16573             :      */
   16574         464 :     catalogRelation = table_open(AttributeRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   16575         464 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
   16576             :                 Anum_pg_attribute_attrelid,
   16577             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   16578             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(child_rel)));
   16579         464 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalogRelation, AttributeRelidNumIndexId,
   16580             :                               true, NULL, 1, key);
   16581        4082 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(attributeTuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   16582             :     {
   16583        3618 :         Form_pg_attribute att = (Form_pg_attribute) GETSTRUCT(attributeTuple);
   16584             : 
   16585             :         /* Ignore if dropped or not inherited */
   16586        3618 :         if (att->attisdropped)
   16587           0 :             continue;
   16588        3618 :         if (att->attinhcount <= 0)
   16589        2802 :             continue;
   16590             : 
   16591         816 :         if (SearchSysCacheExistsAttName(RelationGetRelid(parent_rel),
   16592         816 :                                         NameStr(att->attname)))
   16593             :         {
   16594             :             /* Decrement inhcount and possibly set islocal to true */
   16595         804 :             HeapTuple   copyTuple = heap_copytuple(attributeTuple);
   16596         804 :             Form_pg_attribute copy_att = (Form_pg_attribute) GETSTRUCT(copyTuple);
   16597             : 
   16598         804 :             copy_att->attinhcount--;
   16599         804 :             if (copy_att->attinhcount == 0)
   16600         804 :                 copy_att->attislocal = true;
   16601             : 
   16602         804 :             CatalogTupleUpdate(catalogRelation, &copyTuple->t_self, copyTuple);
   16603         804 :             heap_freetuple(copyTuple);
   16604             :         }
   16605             :     }
   16606         464 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   16607         464 :     table_close(catalogRelation, RowExclusiveLock);
   16608             : 
   16609             :     /*
   16610             :      * Likewise, find inherited check constraints and disinherit them. To do
   16611             :      * this, we first need a list of the names of the parent's check
   16612             :      * constraints.  (We cheat a bit by only checking for name matches,
   16613             :      * assuming that the expressions will match.)
   16614             :      *
   16615             :      * For NOT NULL columns, we store column numbers to match.
   16616             :      */
   16617         464 :     catalogRelation = table_open(ConstraintRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   16618         464 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
   16619             :                 Anum_pg_constraint_conrelid,
   16620             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   16621             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(parent_rel)));
   16622         464 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalogRelation, ConstraintRelidTypidNameIndexId,
   16623             :                               true, NULL, 1, key);
   16624             : 
   16625         464 :     connames = NIL;
   16626         464 :     nncolumns = NIL;
   16627             : 
   16628         678 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(constraintTuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   16629             :     {
   16630         214 :         Form_pg_constraint con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(constraintTuple);
   16631             : 
   16632         214 :         if (con->contype == CONSTRAINT_CHECK)
   16633          12 :             connames = lappend(connames, pstrdup(NameStr(con->conname)));
   16634         214 :         if (con->contype == CONSTRAINT_NOTNULL)
   16635          50 :             nncolumns = lappend_int(nncolumns, extractNotNullColumn(constraintTuple));
   16636             :     }
   16637             : 
   16638         464 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   16639             : 
   16640             :     /* Now scan the child's constraints */
   16641         464 :     ScanKeyInit(&key[0],
   16642             :                 Anum_pg_constraint_conrelid,
   16643             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   16644             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(child_rel)));
   16645         464 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalogRelation, ConstraintRelidTypidNameIndexId,
   16646             :                               true, NULL, 1, key);
   16647             : 
   16648         874 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(constraintTuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   16649             :     {
   16650         410 :         Form_pg_constraint con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(constraintTuple);
   16651         410 :         bool        match = false;
   16652             :         ListCell   *lc;
   16653             : 
   16654             :         /*
   16655             :          * Match CHECK constraints by name, not-null constraints by column
   16656             :          * number, and ignore all others.
   16657             :          */

   16659             :         {

   16661             :             {

   16663          24 :                     strcmp(NameStr(con->conname), (char *) lfirst(lc)) == 0)
   16664             :                 {
   16665          12 :                     match = true;
   16666          12 :                     break;
   16667             :                 }
   16668             :             }

   16677             :                 {
   16678          50 :                     match = true;
   16679          50 :                     break;
   16680             :                 }
   16681             :             }
   16682             :         }
   16683             :         else
   16684         170 :             continue;

   16687             :         {
   16688             :             /* Decrement inhcount and possibly set islocal to true */
   16689          62 :             HeapTuple   copyTuple = heap_copytuple(constraintTuple);
   16690          62 :             Form_pg_constraint copy_con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(copyTuple);
   16691             : 
   16692          62 :             if (copy_con->coninhcount <= 0) /* shouldn't happen */
   16693           0 :                 elog(ERROR, "relation %u has non-inherited constraint \"%s\"",
   16694             :                      RelationGetRelid(child_rel), NameStr(copy_con->conname));
   16695             : 
   16696          62 :             copy_con->coninhcount--;

   16698          62 :                 copy_con->conislocal = true;

   16701          62 :             heap_freetuple(copyTuple);

   16722             : 
   16723             : /*
   16724             :  * Adjust coninhcount of not-null constraints upwards or downwards when a
   16725             :  * table is marked as inheriting or no longer doing so a table with a primary
   16726             :  * key.
   16727             :  *
   16728             :  * Note: these constraints are not dropped, even if their inhcount goes to zero
   16729             :  * and conislocal is false.  Instead we mark the constraints as locally defined.
   16730             :  * This is seen as more useful behavior, with no downsides.  The user can always
   16731             :  * drop them afterwards.
   16732             :  */
   16733             : static void
   16734         262 : ATInheritAdjustNotNulls(Relation parent_rel, Relation child_rel, int inhcount)

   16736             :     Bitmapset  *pkattnos;
   16737             : 
   16738             :     /* Quick exit when parent has no PK */

   16740         220 :         return;
   16741             : 
   16742          42 :     pkattnos = RelationGetIndexAttrBitmap(parent_rel,
   16743             :                                           INDEX_ATTR_BITMAP_PRIMARY_KEY);

   16745             :     {
   16746          36 :         Bitmapset  *childattnums = NULL;
   16747             :         AttrMap    *attmap;
   16748             :         int         i;
   16749             : 
   16750          36 :         attmap = build_attrmap_by_name(RelationGetDescr(parent_rel),

   16757          36 :                                           attmap->attnums[i + FirstLowInvalidHeapAttributeNumber - 1]);

   16759             :

   16761             :          * CCI is needed in case there's a NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY column in the

   16763             :          * its inhcount modified earlier.

   16771             : /*
   16772             :  * Drop the dependency created by StoreCatalogInheritance1 (CREATE TABLE
   16773             :  * INHERITS/ALTER TABLE INHERIT -- refclassid will be RelationRelationId) or
   16774             :  * heap_create_with_catalog (CREATE TABLE OF/ALTER TABLE OF -- refclassid will
   16775             :  * be TypeRelationId).  There's no convenient way to do this, so go trawling

   16819             : 
   16820             : /*
   16821             :  * ALTER TABLE OF
   16822             :  *
   16823             :  * Attach a table to a composite type, as though it had been created with CREATE
   16824             :  * TABLE OF.  All attname, atttypid, atttypmod and attcollation must match.  The
   16825             :  * subject table must not have inheritance parents.  These restrictions ensure
   16826             :  * that you cannot create a configuration impossible with CREATE TABLE OF alone.
   16827             :  *
   16828             :  * The address of the type is returned.
   16829             :  */
   16830             : static ObjectAddress
   16831          66 : ATExecAddOf(Relation rel, const TypeName *ofTypename, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   16832             : {
   16833          66 :     Oid         relid = RelationGetRelid(rel);
   16834             :     Type        typetuple;

   16836             :     Oid         typeid;

   16840             :     ScanKeyData key;

   16842             :                 type_attno;

   16844             :                 tableTupleDesc;
   16845             :     ObjectAddress tableobj,
   16846             :                 typeobj;

   16848             : 
   16849             :     /* Validate the type. */

   16854             : 
   16855             :     /* Fail if the table has any inheritance parents. */

   16966             : /*
   16967             :  * ALTER TABLE NOT OF
   16968             :  *
   16969             :  * Detach a typed table from its originating type.  Just clear reloftype and
   16970             :  * remove the dependency.
   16971             :  */
   16972             : static void
   16973           6 : ATExecDropOf(Relation rel, LOCKMODE lockmode)
   16974             : {
   16975           6 :     Oid         relid = RelationGetRelid(rel);

   16983             :                         RelationGetRelationName(rel))));
   16984             : 
   16985             :     /*
   16986             :      * We don't bother to check ownership of the type --- ownership of the
   16987             :      * table is presumed enough rights.  No lock required on the type, either.
   16988             :      */

   16990           6 :     drop_parent_dependency(relid, TypeRelationId, rel->rd_rel->reloftype,

   17006             : 
   17007             : /*
   17008             :  * relation_mark_replica_identity: Update a table's replica identity
   17009             :  *
   17010             :  * Iff ri_type = REPLICA_IDENTITY_INDEX, indexOid must be the Oid of a suitable
   17011             :  * index. Otherwise, it must be InvalidOid.
   17012             :  *
   17013             :  * Caller had better hold an exclusive lock on the relation, as the results
   17014             :  * of running two of these concurrently wouldn't be pretty.
   17015             :  */
   17016             : static void
   17017         394 : relation_mark_replica_identity(Relation rel, char ri_type, Oid indexOid,
   17018             :                                bool is_internal)
   17019             : {
   17020             :     Relation    pg_index;
   17021             :     Relation    pg_class;
   17022             :     HeapTuple   pg_class_tuple;
   17023             :     HeapTuple   pg_index_tuple;
   17024             :     Form_pg_class pg_class_form;
   17025             :     Form_pg_index pg_index_form;
   17026             :     ListCell   *index;
   17027             : 
   17028             :     /*
   17029             :      * Check whether relreplident has changed, and update it if so.
   17030             :      */
   17031         394 :     pg_class = table_open(RelationRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   17032         394 :     pg_class_tuple = SearchSysCacheCopy1(RELOID,
   17033             :                                          ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(rel)));
   17034         394 :     if (!HeapTupleIsValid(pg_class_tuple))
   17035           0 :         elog(ERROR, "cache lookup failed for relation \"%s\"",
   17036             :              RelationGetRelationName(rel));
   17037         394 :     pg_class_form = (Form_pg_class) GETSTRUCT(pg_class_tuple);
   17038         394 :     if (pg_class_form->relreplident != ri_type)
   17039             :     {
   17040         344 :         pg_class_form->relreplident = ri_type;
   17041         344 :         CatalogTupleUpdate(pg_class, &pg_class_tuple->t_self, pg_class_tuple);
   17042             :     }
   17043         394 :     table_close(pg_class, RowExclusiveLock);
   17044         394 :     heap_freetuple(pg_class_tuple);
   17045             : 
   17046             :     /*
   17047             :      * Update the per-index indisreplident flags correctly.
   17048             :      */
   17049         394 :     pg_index = table_open(IndexRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   17050        1066 :     foreach(index, RelationGetIndexList(rel))
   17051             :     {
   17052         672 :         Oid         thisIndexOid = lfirst_oid(index);
   17053         672 :         bool        dirty = false;
   17054             : 
   17055         672 :         pg_index_tuple = SearchSysCacheCopy1(INDEXRELID,
   17056             :                                              ObjectIdGetDatum(thisIndexOid));
   17057         672 :         if (!HeapTupleIsValid(pg_index_tuple))

   17059         672 :         pg_index_form = (Form_pg_index) GETSTRUCT(pg_index_tuple);
   17060             : 
   17061         672 :         if (thisIndexOid == indexOid)
   17062             :         {
   17063             :             /* Set the bit if not already set. */
   17064         220 :             if (!pg_index_form->indisreplident)
   17065             :             {
   17066         202 :                 dirty = true;
   17067         202 :                 pg_index_form->indisreplident = true;
   17068             :             }
   17069             :         }
   17070             :         else
   17071             :         {
   17072             :             /* Unset the bit if set. */
   17073         452 :             if (pg_index_form->indisreplident)
   17074             :             {
   17075          46 :                 dirty = true;
   17076          46 :                 pg_index_form->indisreplident = false;
   17077             :             }
   17078             :         }
   17079             : 
   17080         672 :         if (dirty)
   17081             :         {
   17082         248 :             CatalogTupleUpdate(pg_index, &pg_index_tuple->t_self, pg_index_tuple);
   17083         248 :             InvokeObjectPostAlterHookArg(IndexRelationId, thisIndexOid, 0,
   17084             :                                          InvalidOid, is_internal);
   17085             : 
   17086             :             /*
   17087             :              * Invalidate the relcache for the table, so that after we commit
   17088             :              * all sessions will refresh the table's replica identity index
   17089             :              * before attempting any UPDATE or DELETE on the table.  (If we
   17090             :              * changed the table's pg_class row above, then a relcache inval
   17091             :              * is already queued due to that; but we might not have.)
   17092             :              */
   17093         248 :             CacheInvalidateRelcache(rel);
   17094             :         }
   17095         672 :         heap_freetuple(pg_index_tuple);
   17096             :     }
   17097             : 
   17098         394 :     table_close(pg_index, RowExclusiveLock);
   17099         394 : }
   17100             : 
   17101             : /*

   17421             : 
   17422             : /*
   17423             :  * Preparation phase for SET LOGGED/UNLOGGED
   17424             :  *
   17425             :  * This verifies that we're not trying to change a temp table.  Also,
   17426             :  * existing foreign key constraints are checked to avoid ending up with
   17427             :  * permanent tables referencing unlogged tables.
   17428             :  *
   17429             :  * Return value is false if the operation is a no-op (in which case the
   17430             :  * checks are skipped), otherwise true.
   17431             :  */
   17432             : static bool
   17433          88 : ATPrepChangePersistence(Relation rel, bool toLogged)
   17434             : {
   17435             :     Relation    pg_constraint;
   17436             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   17437             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   17438             :     ScanKeyData skey[1];
   17439             : 
   17440             :     /*
   17441             :      * Disallow changing status for a temp table.  Also verify whether we can
   17442             :      * get away with doing nothing; in such cases we don't need to run the
   17443             :      * checks below, either.
   17444             :      */
   17445          88 :     switch (rel->rd_rel->relpersistence)
   17446             :     {
   17447           0 :         case RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP:
   17448           0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   17449             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TABLE_DEFINITION),
   17450             :                      errmsg("cannot change logged status of table \"%s\" because it is temporary",
   17451             :                             RelationGetRelationName(rel)),
   17452             :                      errtable(rel)));
   17453             :             break;
   17454          50 :         case RELPERSISTENCE_PERMANENT:
   17455          50 :             if (toLogged)
   17456             :                 /* nothing to do */
   17457           6 :                 return false;
   17458          44 :             break;
   17459          38 :         case RELPERSISTENCE_UNLOGGED:
   17460          38 :             if (!toLogged)
   17461             :                 /* nothing to do */
   17462           6 :                 return false;
   17463          32 :             break;
   17464             :     }
   17465             : 
   17466             :     /*
   17467             :      * Check that the table is not part of any publication when changing to
   17468             :      * UNLOGGED, as UNLOGGED tables can't be published.
   17469             :      */
   17470         120 :     if (!toLogged &&
   17471          44 :         GetRelationPublications(RelationGetRelid(rel)) != NIL)
   17472           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   17473             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   17474             :                  errmsg("cannot change table \"%s\" to unlogged because it is part of a publication",
   17475             :                         RelationGetRelationName(rel)),
   17476             :                  errdetail("Unlogged relations cannot be replicated.")));
   17477             : 
   17478             :     /*
   17479             :      * Check existing foreign key constraints to preserve the invariant that
   17480             :      * permanent tables cannot reference unlogged ones.  Self-referencing
   17481             :      * foreign keys can safely be ignored.
   17482             :      */
   17483          76 :     pg_constraint = table_open(ConstraintRelationId, AccessShareLock);
   17484             : 
   17485             :     /*
   17486             :      * Scan conrelid if changing to permanent, else confrelid.  This also
   17487             :      * determines whether a useful index exists.
   17488             :      */
   17489          76 :     ScanKeyInit(&skey[0],
   17490             :                 toLogged ? Anum_pg_constraint_conrelid :
   17491             :                 Anum_pg_constraint_confrelid,
   17492             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   17493             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(rel)));
   17494          76 :     scan = systable_beginscan(pg_constraint,
   17495             :                               toLogged ? ConstraintRelidTypidNameIndexId : InvalidOid,
   17496             :                               true, NULL, 1, skey);
   17497             : 
   17498         130 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(tuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   17499             :     {
   17500          66 :         Form_pg_constraint con = (Form_pg_constraint) GETSTRUCT(tuple);
   17501             : 
   17502          66 :         if (con->contype == CONSTRAINT_FOREIGN)
   17503             :         {
   17504             :             Oid         foreignrelid;
   17505             :             Relation    foreignrel;
   17506             : 
   17507             :             /* the opposite end of what we used as scankey */
   17508          30 :             foreignrelid = toLogged ? con->confrelid : con->conrelid;
   17509             : 
   17510             :             /* ignore if self-referencing */
   17511          30 :             if (RelationGetRelid(rel) == foreignrelid)
   17512          12 :                 continue;
   17513             : 
   17514          18 :             foreignrel = relation_open(foreignrelid, AccessShareLock);
   17515             : 
   17516          18 :             if (toLogged)
   17517             :             {
   17518           6 :                 if (!RelationIsPermanent(foreignrel))
   17519           6 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   17520             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TABLE_DEFINITION),
   17521             :                              errmsg("could not change table \"%s\" to logged because it references unlogged table \"%s\"",
   17522             :                                     RelationGetRelationName(rel),
   17523             :                                     RelationGetRelationName(foreignrel)),
   17524             :                              errtableconstraint(rel, NameStr(con->conname))));
   17525             :             }
   17526             :             else
   17527             :             {
   17528          12 :                 if (RelationIsPermanent(foreignrel))
   17529           6 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   17530             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TABLE_DEFINITION),
   17531             :                              errmsg("could not change table \"%s\" to unlogged because it references logged table \"%s\"",
   17532             :                                     RelationGetRelationName(rel),
   17533             :                                     RelationGetRelationName(foreignrel)),
   17534             :                              errtableconstraint(rel, NameStr(con->conname))));
   17535             :             }
   17536             : 
   17537           6 :             relation_close(foreignrel, AccessShareLock);
   17538             :         }
   17539             :     }
   17540             : 
   17541          64 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   17542             : 
   17543          64 :     table_close(pg_constraint, AccessShareLock);
   17544             : 
   17545          64 :     return true;
   17546             : }
   17547             : 
   17548             : /*
   17549             :  * Execute ALTER TABLE SET SCHEMA
   17550             :  */
   17551             : ObjectAddress
   17552          98 : AlterTableNamespace(AlterObjectSchemaStmt *stmt, Oid *oldschema)
   17553             : {
   17554             :     Relation    rel;

   17563          98 :                                      stmt->missing_ok ? RVR_MISSING_OK : 0,

   17565             :                                      (void *) stmt);
   17566             : 
   17567          96 :     if (!OidIsValid(relid))
   17568             :     {
   17569          12 :         ereport(NOTICE,
   17570             :                 (errmsg("relation \"%s\" does not exist, skipping",
   17571             :                         stmt->relation->relname)));
   17572          12 :         return InvalidObjectAddress;
   17573             :     }
   17574             : 
   17575          84 :     rel = relation_open(relid, NoLock);

   17577          84 :     oldNspOid = RelationGetNamespace(rel);
   17578             : 
   17579             :     /* If it's an owned sequence, disallow moving it by itself. */
   17580          84 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_SEQUENCE)
   17581             :     {
   17582             :         Oid         tableId;
   17583             :         int32       colId;
   17584             : 
   17585           4 :         if (sequenceIsOwned(relid, DEPENDENCY_AUTO, &tableId, &colId) ||

   17587           0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   17588             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
   17589             :                      errmsg("cannot move an owned sequence into another schema"),
   17590             :                      errdetail("Sequence \"%s\" is linked to table \"%s\".",

   17849             : 
   17850             : /*
   17851             :  * This code supports
   17852             :  *  CREATE TEMP TABLE ... ON COMMIT { DROP | PRESERVE ROWS | DELETE ROWS }
   17853             :  *
   17854             :  * Because we only support this for TEMP tables, it's sufficient to remember
   17855             :  * the state in a backend-local data structure.
   17856             :  */
   17857             : 
   17858             : /*
   17859             :  * Register a newly-created relation's ON COMMIT action.
   17860             :  */
   17861             : void
   17862         166 : register_on_commit_action(Oid relid, OnCommitAction action)
   17863             : {
   17864             :     OnCommitItem *oc;

   17866             : 
   17867             :     /*
   17868             :      * We needn't bother registering the relation unless there is an ON COMMIT
   17869             :      * action we need to take.
   17870             :      */

   17872          24 :         return;

   17875             :

   17880         142 :     oc->deleting_subid = InvalidSubTransactionId;
   17881             : 
   17882             :     /*
   17883             :      * We use lcons() here so that ON COMMIT actions are processed in reverse

   18019             : /*
   18020             :  * Post-commit or post-abort cleanup for ON COMMIT management.
   18021             :  *
   18022             :  * All we do here is remove no-longer-needed OnCommitItem entries.
   18023             :  *
   18024             :  * During commit, remove entries that were deleted during this transaction;
   18025             :  * during abort, remove those created during this transaction.
   18026             :  */
   18027             : void
   18028      519100 : AtEOXact_on_commit_actions(bool isCommit)
   18029             : {
   18030             :     ListCell   *cur_item;
   18031             : 
   18032      519846 :     foreach(cur_item, on_commits)

   18034         746 :         OnCommitItem *oc = (OnCommitItem *) lfirst(cur_item);

   18036         848 :         if (isCommit ? oc->deleting_subid != InvalidSubTransactionId :
   18037         102 :             oc->creating_subid != InvalidSubTransactionId)
   18038             :         {
   18039             :             /* cur_item must be removed */
   18040         142 :             on_commits = foreach_delete_current(on_commits, cur_item);
   18041         142 :             pfree(oc);
   18042             :         }
   18043             :         else
   18044             :         {
   18045             :             /* cur_item must be preserved */
   18046         604 :             oc->creating_subid = InvalidSubTransactionId;

   18051             : 
   18052             : /*
   18053             :  * Post-subcommit or post-subabort cleanup for ON COMMIT management.
   18054             :  *
   18055             :  * During subabort, we can immediately remove entries created during this
   18056             :  * subtransaction.  During subcommit, just relabel entries marked during
   18057             :  * this subtransaction as being the parent's responsibility.
   18058             :  */
   18059             : void
   18060       17674 : AtEOSubXact_on_commit_actions(bool isCommit, SubTransactionId mySubid,
   18061             :                               SubTransactionId parentSubid)
   18062             : {
   18063             :     ListCell   *cur_item;

   18070             :         {
   18071             :             /* cur_item must be removed */
   18072           0 :             on_commits = foreach_delete_current(on_commits, cur_item);
   18073           0 :             pfree(oc);
   18074             :         }
   18075             :         else
   18076             :         {
   18077             :             /* cur_item must be preserved */
   18078           0 :             if (oc->creating_subid == mySubid)
   18079           0 :                 oc->creating_subid = parentSubid;
   18080           0 :             if (oc->deleting_subid == mySubid)
   18081           0 :                 oc->deleting_subid = isCommit ? parentSubid : InvalidSubTransactionId;
   18082             :         }
   18083             :     }
   18084       17674 : }
   18085             : 
   18086             : /*
   18087             :  * This is intended as a callback for RangeVarGetRelidExtended().  It allows
   18088             :  * the relation to be locked only if (1) it's a plain or partitioned table,
   18089             :  * materialized view, or TOAST table and (2) the current user is the owner (or
   18090             :  * the superuser).  This meets the permission-checking needs of CLUSTER,
   18091             :  * REINDEX TABLE, and REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW; we expose it here so that it
   18092             :  * can be used by all.
   18093             :  */
   18094             : void
   18095         900 : RangeVarCallbackOwnsTable(const RangeVar *relation,
   18096             :                           Oid relId, Oid oldRelId, void *arg)
   18097             : {
   18098             :     char        relkind;
   18099             : 
   18100             :     /* Nothing to do if the relation was not found. */
   18101         900 :     if (!OidIsValid(relId))
   18102           6 :         return;
   18103             : 
   18104             :     /*

   18106             :      * the relation might have been dropped between the time we did the name
   18107             :      * lookup and now.  In that case, there's nothing to do.

   18178             : /*
   18179             :  * Common RangeVarGetRelid callback for rename, set schema, and alter table
   18180             :  * processing.
   18181             :  */
   18182             : static void
   18183       32354 : RangeVarCallbackForAlterRelation(const RangeVar *rv, Oid relid, Oid oldrelid,
   18184             :                                  void *arg)
   18185             : {
   18186       32354 :     Node       *stmt = (Node *) arg;
   18187             :     ObjectType  reltype;

   18193       32354 :     tuple = SearchSysCache1(RELOID, ObjectIdGetDatum(relid));
   18194       32354 :     if (!HeapTupleIsValid(tuple))
   18195         242 :         return;                 /* concurrently dropped */
   18196       32112 :     classform = (Form_pg_class) GETSTRUCT(tuple);
   18197       32112 :     relkind = classform->relkind;
   18198             : 
   18199             :     /* Must own relation. */

   18201          60 :         aclcheck_error(ACLCHECK_NOT_OWNER, get_relkind_objtype(get_rel_relkind(relid)), rv->relname);
   18202             : 
   18203             :     /* No system table modifications unless explicitly allowed. */
   18204       32052 :     if (!allowSystemTableMods && IsSystemClass(relid, classform))
   18205          28 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18206             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INSUFFICIENT_PRIVILEGE),
   18207             :                  errmsg("permission denied: \"%s\" is a system catalog",
   18208             :                         rv->relname)));
   18209             : 
   18210             :     /*
   18211             :      * Extract the specified relation type from the statement parse tree.
   18212             :      *
   18213             :      * Also, for ALTER .. RENAME, check permissions: the user must (still)
   18214             :      * have CREATE rights on the containing namespace.
   18215             :      */

   18217             :     {

   18235             : 
   18236             :     /*
   18237             :      * For compatibility with prior releases, we allow ALTER TABLE to be used
   18238             :      * with most other types of relations (but not composite types). We allow
   18239             :      * similar flexibility for ALTER INDEX in the case of RENAME, but not

   18241             :      * command for the relation at issue.

   18252             :

   18254           0 :         ereport(ERROR,

   18257             :

   18262             :

   18264           0 :         ereport(ERROR,

   18266             :                  errmsg("\"%s\" is not a composite type", rv->relname)));
   18267             :

   18269             :         relkind != RELKIND_PARTITIONED_INDEX
   18270          34 :         && !IsA(stmt, RenameStmt))
   18271           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18272             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   18273             :                  errmsg("\"%s\" is not an index", rv->relname)));
   18274             :

   18318             : /*
   18319             :  * Transform any expressions present in the partition key
   18320             :  *
   18321             :  * Returns a transformed PartitionSpec.
   18322             :  */
   18323             : static PartitionSpec *
   18324        4546 : transformPartitionSpec(Relation rel, PartitionSpec *partspec)
   18325             : {
   18326             :     PartitionSpec *newspec;

   18328             :     ParseNamespaceItem *nsitem;

   18331        4546 :     newspec = makeNode(PartitionSpec);

   18334        4546 :     newspec->partParams = NIL;
   18335        4546 :     newspec->location = partspec->location;
   18336             : 
   18337             :     /* Check valid number of columns for strategy */
   18338        6800 :     if (partspec->strategy == PARTITION_STRATEGY_LIST &&
   18339        2254 :         list_length(partspec->partParams) != 1)
   18340           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18341             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   18342             :                  errmsg("cannot use \"list\" partition strategy with more than one column")));
   18343             :

   18347             :      */

   18350             :                                            NULL, false, true);

   18354        9482 :     foreach(l, partspec->partParams)
   18355             :     {
   18356        4966 :         PartitionElem *pelem = lfirst_node(PartitionElem, l);
   18357             : 
   18358        4966 :         if (pelem->expr)
   18359             :         {
   18360             :             /* Copy, to avoid scribbling on the input */
   18361         298 :             pelem = copyObject(pelem);
   18362             :

   18377             : /*
   18378             :  * Compute per-partition-column information from a list of PartitionElems.
   18379             :  * Expressions in the PartitionElems must be parse-analyzed already.
   18380             :  */

   18382        4516 : ComputePartitionAttrs(ParseState *pstate, Relation rel, List *partParams, AttrNumber *partattrs,

   18440         274 :             Node       *expr = pelem->expr;

   18443         274 :             Assert(expr != NULL);
   18444         274 :             atttype = exprType(expr);
   18445         274 :             attcollation = exprCollation(expr);
   18446             : 
   18447             :             /*
   18448             :              * The expression must be of a storable type (e.g., not RECORD).
   18449             :              * The test is the same as for whether a table column is of a safe
   18450             :              * type (which is why we needn't check for the non-expression
   18451             :              * case).

   18454         274 :             CheckAttributeType(partattname,
   18455             :                                atttype, attcollation,

   18457             : 
   18458             :             /*
   18459             :              * Strip any top-level COLLATE clause.  This ensures that we treat
   18460             :              * "x COLLATE y" and "(x COLLATE y)" alike.
   18461             :              */
   18462         262 :             while (IsA(expr, CollateExpr))
   18463           0 :                 expr = (Node *) ((CollateExpr *) expr)->arg;
   18464             : 
   18465         262 :             if (IsA(expr, Var) &&

   18467             :             {
   18468             :                 /*
   18469             :                  * User wrote "(column)" or "(column COLLATE something)".
   18470             :                  * Treat it like simple attribute anyway.
   18471             :                  */

   18473             :             }
   18474             :             else
   18475             :             {
   18476         256 :                 Bitmapset  *expr_attrs = NULL;
   18477             :                 int         i;

   18479         256 :                 partattrs[attn] = 0;    /* marks the column as expression */

   18481             : 
   18482             :                 /*
   18483             :                  * transformPartitionSpec() should have already rejected
   18484             :                  * subqueries, aggregates, window functions, and SRFs, based
   18485             :                  * on the EXPR_KIND_ for partition expressions.
   18486             :                  */
   18487             : 
   18488             :                 /*
   18489             :                  * Cannot allow system column references, since that would
   18490             :                  * make partition routing impossible: their values won't be
   18491             :                  * known yet when we need to do that.
   18492             :                  */
   18493         256 :                 pull_varattnos(expr, 1, &expr_attrs);
   18494        2048 :                 for (i = FirstLowInvalidHeapAttributeNumber; i < 0; i++)

   18496        1792 :                     if (bms_is_member(i - FirstLowInvalidHeapAttributeNumber,
   18497             :                                       expr_attrs))
   18498           0 :                         ereport(ERROR,
   18499             :                                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   18500             :                                  errmsg("partition key expressions cannot contain system column references")));
   18501             :                 }
   18502             : 
   18503             :                 /*
   18504             :                  * Generated columns cannot work: They are computed after
   18505             :                  * BEFORE triggers, but partition routing is done before all
   18506             :                  * triggers.
   18507             :                  */
   18508         256 :                 i = -1;
   18509         564 :                 while ((i = bms_next_member(expr_attrs, i)) >= 0)
   18510             :                 {
   18511         314 :                     AttrNumber  attno = i + FirstLowInvalidHeapAttributeNumber;
   18512             : 
   18513         314 :                     if (attno > 0 &&
   18514         308 :                         TupleDescAttr(RelationGetDescr(rel), attno - 1)->attgenerated)
   18515           6 :                         ereport(ERROR,
   18516             :                                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   18517             :                                  errmsg("cannot use generated column in partition key"),
   18518             :                                  errdetail("Column \"%s\" is a generated column.",
   18519             :                                            get_attname(RelationGetRelid(rel), attno, false)),
   18520             :                                  parser_errposition(pstate, pelem->location)));
   18521             :                 }
   18522             : 
   18523             :                 /*
   18524             :                  * Preprocess the expression before checking for mutability.
   18525             :                  * This is essential for the reasons described in
   18526             :                  * contain_mutable_functions_after_planning.  However, we call
   18527             :                  * expression_planner for ourselves rather than using that
   18528             :                  * function, because if constant-folding reduces the
   18529             :                  * expression to a constant, we'd like to know that so we can
   18530             :                  * complain below.
   18531             :                  *
   18532             :                  * Like contain_mutable_functions_after_planning, assume that
   18533             :                  * expression_planner won't scribble on its input, so this
   18534             :                  * won't affect the partexprs entry we saved above.
   18535             :                  */
   18536         250 :                 expr = (Node *) expression_planner((Expr *) expr);
   18537             : 
   18538             :                 /*
   18539             :                  * Partition expressions cannot contain mutable functions,
   18540             :                  * because a given row must always map to the same partition
   18541             :                  * as long as there is no change in the partition boundary
   18542             :                  * structure.
   18543             :                  */
   18544         250 :                 if (contain_mutable_functions(expr))
   18545           6 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   18546             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   18547             :                              errmsg("functions in partition key expression must be marked IMMUTABLE")));
   18548             : 
   18549             :                 /*
   18550             :                  * While it is not exactly *wrong* for a partition expression
   18551             :                  * to be a constant, it seems better to reject such keys.
   18552             :                  */
   18553         244 :                 if (IsA(expr, Const))
   18554          12 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   18555             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_OBJECT_DEFINITION),
   18556             :                              errmsg("cannot use constant expression as partition key")));
   18557             :             }
   18558             :         }
   18559             : 
   18560             :         /*
   18561             :          * Apply collation override if any
   18562             :          */
   18563        4882 :         if (pelem->collation)
   18564          30 :             attcollation = get_collation_oid(pelem->collation, false);
   18565             : 
   18566             :         /*
   18567             :          * Check we have a collation iff it's a collatable type.  The only
   18568             :          * expected failures here are (1) COLLATE applied to a noncollatable
   18569             :          * type, or (2) partition expression had an unresolved collation. But
   18570             :          * we might as well code this to be a complete consistency check.
   18571             :          */
   18572        4882 :         if (type_is_collatable(atttype))
   18573             :         {
   18574         558 :             if (!OidIsValid(attcollation))
   18575           0 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   18576             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_INDETERMINATE_COLLATION),
   18577             :                          errmsg("could not determine which collation to use for partition expression"),
   18578             :                          errhint("Use the COLLATE clause to set the collation explicitly.")));
   18579             :         }
   18580             :         else
   18581             :         {
   18582        4324 :             if (OidIsValid(attcollation))
   18583           0 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   18584             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_DATATYPE_MISMATCH),
   18585             :                          errmsg("collations are not supported by type %s",
   18586             :                                 format_type_be(atttype))));
   18587             :         }
   18588             : 
   18589        4882 :         partcollation[attn] = attcollation;
   18590             : 
   18591             :         /*
   18592             :          * Identify the appropriate operator class.  For list and range
   18593             :          * partitioning, we use a btree operator class; hash partitioning uses
   18594             :          * a hash operator class.
   18595             :          */
   18596        4882 :         if (strategy == PARTITION_STRATEGY_HASH)
   18597         256 :             am_oid = HASH_AM_OID;
   18598             :         else
   18599        4626 :             am_oid = BTREE_AM_OID;
   18600             : 
   18601        4882 :         if (!pelem->opclass)
   18602             :         {
   18603        4750 :             partopclass[attn] = GetDefaultOpClass(atttype, am_oid);
   18604             : 
   18605        4750 :             if (!OidIsValid(partopclass[attn]))
   18606             :             {
   18607          12 :                 if (strategy == PARTITION_STRATEGY_HASH)
   18608           0 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   18609             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_UNDEFINED_OBJECT),
   18610             :                              errmsg("data type %s has no default operator class for access method \"%s\"",
   18611             :                                     format_type_be(atttype), "hash"),
   18612             :                              errhint("You must specify a hash operator class or define a default hash operator class for the data type.")));
   18613             :                 else
   18614          12 :                     ereport(ERROR,
   18615             :                             (errcode(ERRCODE_UNDEFINED_OBJECT),
   18616             :                              errmsg("data type %s has no default operator class for access method \"%s\"",
   18617             :                                     format_type_be(atttype), "btree"),
   18618             :                              errhint("You must specify a btree operator class or define a default btree operator class for the data type.")));
   18619             :             }
   18620             :         }
   18621             :         else
   18622         132 :             partopclass[attn] = ResolveOpClass(pelem->opclass,
   18623             :                                                atttype,
   18624             :                                                am_oid == HASH_AM_OID ? "hash" : "btree",
   18625             :                                                am_oid);
   18626             : 
   18627        4858 :         attn++;
   18628             :     }
   18629        4432 : }
   18630             : 
   18631             : /*
   18632             :  * PartConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint
   18633             :  *      Do scanrel's existing constraints imply the partition constraint?
   18634             :  *
   18635             :  * "Existing constraints" include its check constraints and column-level
   18636             :  * not-null constraints.  partConstraint describes the partition constraint,
   18637             :  * in implicit-AND form.
   18638             :  */
   18639             : bool
   18640        2916 : PartConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint(Relation scanrel,
   18641             :                                      List *partConstraint)
   18642             : {
   18643        2916 :     List       *existConstraint = NIL;
   18644        2916 :     TupleConstr *constr = RelationGetDescr(scanrel)->constr;
   18645             :     int         i;
   18646             : 
   18647        2916 :     if (constr && constr->has_not_null)
   18648             :     {
   18649         684 :         int         natts = scanrel->rd_att->natts;
   18650             : 
   18651        2184 :         for (i = 1; i <= natts; i++)
   18652             :         {
   18653        1500 :             Form_pg_attribute att = TupleDescAttr(scanrel->rd_att, i - 1);
   18654             : 
   18655        1500 :             if (att->attnotnull && !att->attisdropped)
   18656             :             {
   18657         902 :                 NullTest   *ntest = makeNode(NullTest);
   18658             : 
   18659         902 :                 ntest->arg = (Expr *) makeVar(1,
   18660             :                                               i,
   18661             :                                               att->atttypid,
   18662             :                                               att->atttypmod,
   18663             :                                               att->attcollation,
   18664             :                                               0);
   18665         902 :                 ntest->nulltesttype = IS_NOT_NULL;
   18666             : 
   18667             :                 /*
   18668             :                  * argisrow=false is correct even for a composite column,
   18669             :                  * because attnotnull does not represent a SQL-spec IS NOT
   18670             :                  * NULL test in such a case, just IS DISTINCT FROM NULL.
   18671             :                  */
   18672         902 :                 ntest->argisrow = false;
   18673         902 :                 ntest->location = -1;
   18674         902 :                 existConstraint = lappend(existConstraint, ntest);
   18675             :             }
   18676             :         }
   18677             :     }
   18678             : 
   18679        2916 :     return ConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint(scanrel, partConstraint, existConstraint);
   18680             : }
   18681             : 
   18682             : /*
   18683             :  * ConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint
   18684             :  *      Do scanrel's existing constraints imply the given constraint?
   18685             :  *
   18686             :  * testConstraint is the constraint to validate. provenConstraint is a
   18687             :  * caller-provided list of conditions which this function may assume
   18688             :  * to be true. Both provenConstraint and testConstraint must be in
   18689             :  * implicit-AND form, must only contain immutable clauses, and must
   18690             :  * contain only Vars with varno = 1.
   18691             :  */
   18692             : bool
   18693        4164 : ConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint(Relation scanrel, List *testConstraint, List *provenConstraint)
   18694             : {
   18695        4164 :     List       *existConstraint = list_copy(provenConstraint);
   18696        4164 :     TupleConstr *constr = RelationGetDescr(scanrel)->constr;
   18697             :     int         num_check,
   18698             :                 i;
   18699             : 
   18700        4164 :     num_check = (constr != NULL) ? constr->num_check : 0;
   18701        4714 :     for (i = 0; i < num_check; i++)
   18702             :     {
   18703             :         Node       *cexpr;
   18704             : 
   18705             :         /*
   18706             :          * If this constraint hasn't been fully validated yet, we must ignore
   18707             :          * it here.
   18708             :          */
   18709         550 :         if (!constr->check[i].ccvalid)
   18710           6 :             continue;
   18711             : 
   18712         544 :         cexpr = stringToNode(constr->check[i].ccbin);
   18713             : 
   18714             :         /*
   18715             :          * Run each expression through const-simplification and
   18716             :          * canonicalization.  It is necessary, because we will be comparing it
   18717             :          * to similarly-processed partition constraint expressions, and may
   18718             :          * fail to detect valid matches without this.
   18719             :          */
   18720         544 :         cexpr = eval_const_expressions(NULL, cexpr);
   18721         544 :         cexpr = (Node *) canonicalize_qual((Expr *) cexpr, true);
   18722             : 
   18723         544 :         existConstraint = list_concat(existConstraint,
   18724         544 :                                       make_ands_implicit((Expr *) cexpr));
   18725             :     }
   18726             : 
   18727             :     /*
   18728             :      * Try to make the proof.  Since we are comparing CHECK constraints, we
   18729             :      * need to use weak implication, i.e., we assume existConstraint is
   18730             :      * not-false and try to prove the same for testConstraint.
   18731             :      *
   18732             :      * Note that predicate_implied_by assumes its first argument is known
   18733             :      * immutable.  That should always be true for both NOT NULL and partition
   18734             :      * constraints, so we don't test it here.
   18735             :      */
   18736        4164 :     return predicate_implied_by(testConstraint, existConstraint, true);
   18737             : }
   18738             : 
   18739             : /*
   18740             :  * QueuePartitionConstraintValidation
   18741             :  *
   18742             :  * Add an entry to wqueue to have the given partition constraint validated by
   18743             :  * Phase 3, for the given relation, and all its children.
   18744             :  *
   18745             :  * We first verify whether the given constraint is implied by pre-existing
   18746             :  * relation constraints; if it is, there's no need to scan the table to
   18747             :  * validate, so don't queue in that case.
   18748             :  */
   18749             : static void
   18750        2298 : QueuePartitionConstraintValidation(List **wqueue, Relation scanrel,
   18751             :                                    List *partConstraint,
   18752             :                                    bool validate_default)
   18753             : {
   18754             :     /*
   18755             :      * Based on the table's existing constraints, determine whether or not we
   18756             :      * may skip scanning the table.
   18757             :      */
   18758        2298 :     if (PartConstraintImpliedByRelConstraint(scanrel, partConstraint))
   18759             :     {
   18760          90 :         if (!validate_default)
   18761          68 :             ereport(DEBUG1,
   18762             :                     (errmsg_internal("partition constraint for table \"%s\" is implied by existing constraints",
   18763             :                                      RelationGetRelationName(scanrel))));
   18764             :         else
   18765          22 :             ereport(DEBUG1,
   18766             :                     (errmsg_internal("updated partition constraint for default partition \"%s\" is implied by existing constraints",
   18767             :                                      RelationGetRelationName(scanrel))));
   18768          90 :         return;
   18769             :     }
   18770             : 
   18771             :     /*
   18772             :      * Constraints proved insufficient. For plain relations, queue a
   18773             :      * validation item now; for partitioned tables, recurse to process each
   18774             :      * partition.
   18775             :      */
   18776        2208 :     if (scanrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_RELATION)
   18777             :     {
   18778             :         AlteredTableInfo *tab;
   18779             : 
   18780             :         /* Grab a work queue entry. */
   18781        1832 :         tab = ATGetQueueEntry(wqueue, scanrel);
   18782        1832 :         Assert(tab->partition_constraint == NULL);
   18783        1832 :         tab->partition_constraint = (Expr *) linitial(partConstraint);
   18784        1832 :         tab->validate_default = validate_default;
   18785             :     }
   18786         376 :     else if (scanrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   18787             :     {
   18788         328 :         PartitionDesc partdesc = RelationGetPartitionDesc(scanrel, true);
   18789             :         int         i;
   18790             : 
   18791         686 :         for (i = 0; i < partdesc->nparts; i++)
   18792             :         {
   18793             :             Relation    part_rel;
   18794             :             List       *thisPartConstraint;
   18795             : 
   18796             :             /*
   18797             :              * This is the minimum lock we need to prevent deadlocks.
   18798             :              */
   18799         358 :             part_rel = table_open(partdesc->oids[i], AccessExclusiveLock);
   18800             : 
   18801             :             /*
   18802             :              * Adjust the constraint for scanrel so that it matches this
   18803             :              * partition's attribute numbers.
   18804             :              */
   18805             :             thisPartConstraint =
   18806         358 :                 map_partition_varattnos(partConstraint, 1,
   18807             :                                         part_rel, scanrel);
   18808             : 
   18809         358 :             QueuePartitionConstraintValidation(wqueue, part_rel,
   18810             :                                                thisPartConstraint,
   18811             :                                                validate_default);
   18812         358 :             table_close(part_rel, NoLock);  /* keep lock till commit */
   18813             :         }
   18814             :     }
   18815             : }
   18816             : 
   18817             : /*
   18818             :  * ALTER TABLE <name> ATTACH PARTITION <partition-name> FOR VALUES
   18819             :  *
   18820             :  * Return the address of the newly attached partition.
   18821             :  */
   18822             : static ObjectAddress
   18823        2106 : ATExecAttachPartition(List **wqueue, Relation rel, PartitionCmd *cmd,
   18824             :                       AlterTableUtilityContext *context)
   18825             : {
   18826             :     Relation    attachrel,
   18827             :                 catalog;
   18828             :     List       *attachrel_children;
   18829             :     List       *partConstraint;
   18830             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   18831             :     ScanKeyData skey;
   18832             :     AttrNumber  attno;
   18833             :     int         natts;
   18834             :     TupleDesc   tupleDesc;
   18835             :     ObjectAddress address;
   18836             :     const char *trigger_name;
   18837             :     Oid         defaultPartOid;
   18838             :     List       *partBoundConstraint;
   18839        2106 :     ParseState *pstate = make_parsestate(NULL);
   18840             : 
   18841        2106 :     pstate->p_sourcetext = context->queryString;
   18842             : 
   18843             :     /*
   18844             :      * We must lock the default partition if one exists, because attaching a
   18845             :      * new partition will change its partition constraint.
   18846             :      */
   18847             :     defaultPartOid =
   18848        2106 :         get_default_oid_from_partdesc(RelationGetPartitionDesc(rel, true));
   18849        2106 :     if (OidIsValid(defaultPartOid))
   18850         182 :         LockRelationOid(defaultPartOid, AccessExclusiveLock);
   18851             : 
   18852        2106 :     attachrel = table_openrv(cmd->name, AccessExclusiveLock);
   18853             : 
   18854             :     /*
   18855             :      * XXX I think it'd be a good idea to grab locks on all tables referenced
   18856             :      * by FKs at this point also.
   18857             :      */
   18858             : 
   18859             :     /*
   18860             :      * Must be owner of both parent and source table -- parent was checked by
   18861             :      * ATSimplePermissions call in ATPrepCmd
   18862             :      */
   18863        2100 :     ATSimplePermissions(AT_AttachPartition, attachrel, ATT_TABLE | ATT_FOREIGN_TABLE);
   18864             : 
   18865             :     /* A partition can only have one parent */
   18866        2094 :     if (attachrel->rd_rel->relispartition)
   18867           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18868             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   18869             :                  errmsg("\"%s\" is already a partition",
   18870             :                         RelationGetRelationName(attachrel))));
   18871             : 
   18872        2088 :     if (OidIsValid(attachrel->rd_rel->reloftype))
   18873           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18874             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   18875             :                  errmsg("cannot attach a typed table as partition")));
   18876             : 
   18877             :     /*
   18878             :      * Table being attached should not already be part of inheritance; either
   18879             :      * as a child table...

   18881        2082 :     catalog = table_open(InheritsRelationId, AccessShareLock);
   18882        2082 :     ScanKeyInit(&skey,

   18892        2076 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   18893             : 
   18894             :     /* ...or as a parent table (except the case when it is partitioned) */
   18895        2076 :     ScanKeyInit(&skey,
   18896             :                 Anum_pg_inherits_inhparent,
   18897             :                 BTEqualStrategyNumber, F_OIDEQ,
   18898             :                 ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(attachrel)));
   18899        2076 :     scan = systable_beginscan(catalog, InheritsParentIndexId, true, NULL,
   18900             :                               1, &skey);
   18901        2076 :     if (HeapTupleIsValid(systable_getnext(scan)) &&
   18902         230 :         attachrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_RELATION)
   18903           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18904             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   18905             :                  errmsg("cannot attach inheritance parent as partition")));
   18906        2070 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   18907        2070 :     table_close(catalog, AccessShareLock);
   18908             : 
   18909             :     /*
   18910             :      * Prevent circularity by seeing if rel is a partition of attachrel. (In
   18911             :      * particular, this disallows making a rel a partition of itself.)
   18912             :      *
   18913             :      * We do that by checking if rel is a member of the list of attachrel's
   18914             :      * partitions provided the latter is partitioned at all.  We want to avoid
   18915             :      * having to construct this list again, so we request the strongest lock
   18916             :      * on all partitions.  We need the strongest lock, because we may decide
   18917             :      * to scan them if we find out that the table being attached (or its leaf
   18918             :      * partitions) may contain rows that violate the partition constraint. If
   18919             :      * the table has a constraint that would prevent such rows, which by
   18920             :      * definition is present in all the partitions, we need not scan the
   18921             :      * table, nor its partitions.  But we cannot risk a deadlock by taking a
   18922             :      * weaker lock now and the stronger one only when needed.
   18923             :      */
   18924        2070 :     attachrel_children = find_all_inheritors(RelationGetRelid(attachrel),
   18925             :                                              AccessExclusiveLock, NULL);
   18926        2070 :     if (list_member_oid(attachrel_children, RelationGetRelid(rel)))
   18927          12 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18928             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_DUPLICATE_TABLE),
   18929             :                  errmsg("circular inheritance not allowed"),
   18930             :                  errdetail("\"%s\" is already a child of \"%s\".",
   18931             :                            RelationGetRelationName(rel),
   18932             :                            RelationGetRelationName(attachrel))));
   18933             : 
   18934             :     /* If the parent is permanent, so must be all of its partitions. */
   18935        2058 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relpersistence != RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP &&
   18936        2034 :         attachrel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP)
   18937           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18938             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   18939             :                  errmsg("cannot attach a temporary relation as partition of permanent relation \"%s\"",
   18940             :                         RelationGetRelationName(rel))));
   18941             : 
   18942             :     /* Temp parent cannot have a partition that is itself not a temp */
   18943        2052 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP &&
   18944          24 :         attachrel->rd_rel->relpersistence != RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP)
   18945          18 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18946             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   18947             :                  errmsg("cannot attach a permanent relation as partition of temporary relation \"%s\"",
   18948             :                         RelationGetRelationName(rel))));

   18950             :     /* If the parent is temp, it must belong to this session */
   18951        2034 :     if (rel->rd_rel->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP &&
   18952           6 :         !rel->rd_islocaltemp)
   18953           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18954             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   18955             :                  errmsg("cannot attach as partition of temporary relation of another session")));

   18957             :     /* Ditto for the partition */

   18959           6 :         !attachrel->rd_islocaltemp)
   18960           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   18961             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),
   18962             :                  errmsg("cannot attach temporary relation of another session as partition")));
   18963             : 
   18964             :     /*
   18965             :      * Check if attachrel has any identity columns or any columns that aren't
   18966             :      * in the parent.

   18968        2034 :     tupleDesc = RelationGetDescr(attachrel);

   18970        6972 :     for (attno = 1; attno <= natts; attno++)

   18974             : 
   18975             :         /* Ignore dropped */

   18978             : 
   18979        4418 :         if (attribute->attidentity)
   18980          18 :             ereport(ERROR,
   18981             :                     errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),

   18983             :                            RelationGetRelationName(attachrel), attributeName),
   18984             :                     errdetail("The new partition may not contain an identity column."));
   18985             : 
   18986             :         /* Try to find the column in parent (matching on column name) */
   18987        4400 :         if (!SearchSysCacheExists2(ATTNAME,
   18988             :                                    ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(rel)),

   18991             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_DATATYPE_MISMATCH),
   18992             :                      errmsg("table \"%s\" contains column \"%s\" not found in parent \"%s\"",

   18994             :                             RelationGetRelationName(rel)),
   18995             :                      errdetail("The new partition may contain only the columns present in parent.")));

   18997             : 
   18998             :     /*
   18999             :      * If child_rel has row-level triggers with transition tables, we
   19000             :      * currently don't allow it to become a partition.  See also prohibitions
   19001             :      * in ATExecAddInherit() and CreateTrigger().

   19011             :     /*

   19022             :     /* Update the pg_class entry. */
   19023        1884 :     StorePartitionBound(attachrel, rel, cmd->bound);

   19053             :          */
