   19069        1794 :         QueuePartitionConstraintValidation(wqueue, attachrel, partConstraint,
   19070             :                                            false);
   19071             :     }
   19072             : 
   19073             :     /*
   19074             :      * If we're attaching a partition other than the default partition and a
   19075             :      * default one exists, then that partition's partition constraint changes,
   19076             :      * so add an entry to the work queue to validate it, too.  (We must not do
   19077             :      * this when the partition being attached is the default one; we already
   19078             :      * did it above!)
   19079             :      */
   19080        1842 :     if (OidIsValid(defaultPartOid))
   19081             :     {
   19082             :         Relation    defaultrel;
   19083             :         List       *defPartConstraint;
   19084             : 
   19085         146 :         Assert(!cmd->bound->is_default);
   19086             : 
   19087             :         /* we already hold a lock on the default partition */
   19088         146 :         defaultrel = table_open(defaultPartOid, NoLock);
   19089             :         defPartConstraint =
   19090         146 :             get_proposed_default_constraint(partBoundConstraint);
   19091             : 
   19092             :         /*
   19093             :          * Map the Vars in the constraint expression from rel's attnos to
   19094             :          * defaultrel's.
   19095             :          */
   19096             :         defPartConstraint =
   19097         146 :             map_partition_varattnos(defPartConstraint,
   19098             :                                     1, defaultrel, rel);
   19099         146 :         QueuePartitionConstraintValidation(wqueue, defaultrel,
   19100             :                                            defPartConstraint, true);
   19101             : 
   19102             :         /* keep our lock until commit. */
   19103         146 :         table_close(defaultrel, NoLock);
   19104             :     }
   19105             : 
   19106        1842 :     ObjectAddressSet(address, RelationRelationId, RelationGetRelid(attachrel));
   19107             : 
   19108             :     /*
   19109             :      * If the partition we just attached is partitioned itself, invalidate
   19110             :      * relcache for all descendent partitions too to ensure that their
   19111             :      * rd_partcheck expression trees are rebuilt; partitions already locked at
   19112             :      * the beginning of this function.
   19113             :      */
   19114        1842 :     if (attachrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   19115             :     {
   19116             :         ListCell   *l;
   19117             : 
   19118         924 :         foreach(l, attachrel_children)
   19119             :         {
   19120         620 :             CacheInvalidateRelcacheByRelid(lfirst_oid(l));
   19121             :         }
   19122             :     }
   19123             : 
   19124             :     /* keep our lock until commit */
   19125        1842 :     table_close(attachrel, NoLock);
   19126             : 
   19127        1842 :     return address;
   19128             : }
   19129             : 
   19130             : /*
   19131             :  * AttachPartitionEnsureIndexes
   19132             :  *      subroutine for ATExecAttachPartition to create/match indexes
   19133             :  *
   19134             :  * Enforce the indexing rule for partitioned tables during ALTER TABLE / ATTACH
   19135             :  * PARTITION: every partition must have an index attached to each index on the
   19136             :  * partitioned table.
   19137             :  */
   19138             : static void
   19139        1884 : AttachPartitionEnsureIndexes(List **wqueue, Relation rel, Relation attachrel)
   19140             : {
   19141             :     List       *idxes;
   19142             :     List       *attachRelIdxs;
   19143             :     Relation   *attachrelIdxRels;
   19144             :     IndexInfo **attachInfos;
   19145             :     ListCell   *cell;
   19146             :     MemoryContext cxt;
   19147             :     MemoryContext oldcxt;
   19148             : 
   19149        1884 :     cxt = AllocSetContextCreate(CurrentMemoryContext,
   19150             :                                 "AttachPartitionEnsureIndexes",
   19151             :                                 ALLOCSET_DEFAULT_SIZES);
   19152        1884 :     oldcxt = MemoryContextSwitchTo(cxt);
   19153             : 
   19154        1884 :     idxes = RelationGetIndexList(rel);
   19155        1884 :     attachRelIdxs = RelationGetIndexList(attachrel);
   19156        1884 :     attachrelIdxRels = palloc(sizeof(Relation) * list_length(attachRelIdxs));
   19157        1884 :     attachInfos = palloc(sizeof(IndexInfo *) * list_length(attachRelIdxs));
   19158             : 
   19159             :     /* Build arrays of all existing indexes and their IndexInfos */
   19160        2188 :     foreach(cell, attachRelIdxs)
   19161             :     {
   19162         304 :         Oid         cldIdxId = lfirst_oid(cell);
   19163         304 :         int         i = foreach_current_index(cell);
   19164             : 
   19165         304 :         attachrelIdxRels[i] = index_open(cldIdxId, AccessShareLock);
   19166         304 :         attachInfos[i] = BuildIndexInfo(attachrelIdxRels[i]);
   19167             :     }
   19168             : 
   19169             :     /*
   19170             :      * If we're attaching a foreign table, we must fail if any of the indexes
   19171             :      * is a constraint index; otherwise, there's nothing to do here.  Do this
   19172             :      * before starting work, to avoid wasting the effort of building a few
   19173             :      * non-unique indexes before coming across a unique one.
   19174             :      */
   19175        1884 :     if (attachrel->rd_rel->relkind == RELKIND_FOREIGN_TABLE)
   19176             :     {
   19177          86 :         foreach(cell, idxes)
   19178             :         {
   19179          36 :             Oid         idx = lfirst_oid(cell);

   19183          24 :                 idxRel->rd_index->indisprimary)
   19184          12 :                 ereport(ERROR,
   19185             :                         (errcode(ERRCODE_WRONG_OBJECT_TYPE),

   19188             :                                 RelationGetRelationName(rel)),
   19189             :                          errdetail("Partitioned table \"%s\" contains unique indexes.",

   19191          24 :             index_close(idxRel, AccessShareLock);
   19192             :         }
   19193             : 
   19194          50 :         goto out;
   19195             :     }
   19196             : 
   19197             :     /*
   19198             :      * For each index on the partitioned table, find a matching one in the
   19199             :      * partition-to-be; if one is not found, create one.
   19200             :      */
   19201        2196 :     foreach(cell, idxes)
   19202             :     {
   19203         398 :         Oid         idx = lfirst_oid(cell);

   19205             :         IndexInfo  *info;
   19206             :         AttrMap    *attmap;

   19208             :         Oid         constraintOid;
   19209             : 
   19210             :         /*
   19211             :          * Ignore indexes in the partitioned table other than partitioned
   19212             :          * indexes.
   19213             :          */
   19214         398 :         if (idxRel->rd_rel->relkind != RELKIND_PARTITIONED_INDEX)
   19215             :         {
   19216           0 :             index_close(idxRel, AccessShareLock);
   19217           0 :             continue;
   19218             :         }
   19219             :

   19224             :                                        false);
   19225         398 :         constraintOid = get_relation_idx_constraint_oid(RelationGetRelid(rel), idx);

   19227             :         /*

   19229             :          * the first matching, valid, unattached one we find, if any, as
   19230             :          * partition of the parent index.  If we find one, we're done.
   19231             :          */

   19237             :             /* does this index have a parent?  if so, can't use it */
   19238         226 :             if (attachrelIdxRels[i]->rd_rel->relispartition)
   19239          12 :                 continue;
   19240             : 
   19241             :             /* If this index is invalid, can't use it */
   19242         214 :             if (!attachrelIdxRels[i]->rd_index->indisvalid)

   19250             :                                  attmap))
   19251             :             {
   19252             :                 /*
   19253             :                  * If this index is being created in the parent because of a
   19254             :                  * constraint, then the child needs to have a constraint also,

   19274             :

   19278             :         }
   19279             : 
   19280             :         /*
   19281             :          * If no suitable index was found in the partition-to-be, create one

   19285             :         {

   19292             :

   19298             :             {
   19299         124 :                 MemoryContextSwitchTo(oldcxt);

   19320             : 
   19321         374 :         index_close(idxRel, AccessShareLock);
   19322             :     }
   19323             : 
   19324        1848 : out:
   19325             :     /* Clean up. */
   19326        2140 :     for (int i = 0; i < list_length(attachRelIdxs); i++)

   19331             : 
   19332             : /*
   19333             :  * CloneRowTriggersToPartition
   19334             :  *      subroutine for ATExecAttachPartition/DefineRelation to create row

   19336             :  */
   19337             : static void
   19338        2232 : CloneRowTriggersToPartition(Relation parent, Relation partition)
   19339             : {
   19340             :     Relation    pg_trigger;
   19341             :     ScanKeyData key;
   19342             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   19343             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   19344             :     MemoryContext perTupCxt;
   19345             : 
   19346        2232 :     ScanKeyInit(&key, Anum_pg_trigger_tgrelid, BTEqualStrategyNumber,
   19347             :                 F_OIDEQ, ObjectIdGetDatum(RelationGetRelid(parent)));
   19348        2232 :     pg_trigger = table_open(TriggerRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   19349        2232 :     scan = systable_beginscan(pg_trigger, TriggerRelidNameIndexId,
   19350             :                               true, NULL, 1, &key);
   19351             : 
   19352        2232 :     perTupCxt = AllocSetContextCreate(CurrentMemoryContext,
   19353             :                                       "clone trig", ALLOCSET_SMALL_SIZES);
   19354             : 
   19355        3608 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(tuple = systable_getnext(scan)))
   19356             :     {
   19357        1382 :         Form_pg_trigger trigForm = (Form_pg_trigger) GETSTRUCT(tuple);
   19358             :         CreateTrigStmt *trigStmt;
   19359        1382 :         Node       *qual = NULL;
   19360             :         Datum       value;
   19361             :         bool        isnull;
   19362        1382 :         List       *cols = NIL;
   19363        1382 :         List       *trigargs = NIL;
   19364             :         MemoryContext oldcxt;
   19365             : 
   19366             :         /*
   19367             :          * Ignore statement-level triggers; those are not cloned.
   19368             :          */
   19369        1382 :         if (!TRIGGER_FOR_ROW(trigForm->tgtype))
   19370        1226 :             continue;
   19371             : 
   19372             :         /*
   19373             :          * Don't clone internal triggers, because the constraint cloning code
   19374             :          * will.
   19375             :          */
   19376        1382 :         if (trigForm->tgisinternal)
   19377        1226 :             continue;
   19378             : 
   19379             :         /*
   19380             :          * Complain if we find an unexpected trigger type.
   19381             :          */
   19382         156 :         if (!TRIGGER_FOR_BEFORE(trigForm->tgtype) &&
   19383         138 :             !TRIGGER_FOR_AFTER(trigForm->tgtype))
   19384           0 :             elog(ERROR, "unexpected trigger \"%s\" found",
   19385             :                  NameStr(trigForm->tgname));
   19386             : 
   19387             :         /* Use short-lived context for CREATE TRIGGER */
   19388         156 :         oldcxt = MemoryContextSwitchTo(perTupCxt);
   19389             : 
   19390             :         /*
   19391             :          * If there is a WHEN clause, generate a 'cooked' version of it that's
   19392             :          * appropriate for the partition.

   19394         156 :         value = heap_getattr(tuple, Anum_pg_trigger_tgqual,
   19395             :                              RelationGetDescr(pg_trigger), &isnull);
   19396         156 :         if (!isnull)
   19397             :         {
   19398           6 :             qual = stringToNode(TextDatumGetCString(value));
   19399           6 :             qual = (Node *) map_partition_varattnos((List *) qual, PRS2_OLD_VARNO,
   19400             :                                                     partition, parent);
   19401           6 :             qual = (Node *) map_partition_varattnos((List *) qual, PRS2_NEW_VARNO,
   19402             :                                                     partition, parent);
   19403             :         }

   19405             :         /*
   19406             :          * If there is a column list, transform it to a list of column names.
   19407             :          * Note we don't need to map this list in any way ...

   19409         156 :         if (trigForm->tgattr.dim1 > 0)

   19442             :         }

   19444         156 :         trigStmt = makeNode(CreateTrigStmt);
   19445         156 :         trigStmt->replace = false;

   19459         156 :         trigStmt->constrrel = NULL; /* passed separately */

   19470        2226 :     MemoryContextDelete(perTupCxt);

   19472        2226 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   19473        2226 :     table_close(pg_trigger, RowExclusiveLock);
   19474        2226 : }
   19475             : 
   19476             : /*
   19477             :  * ALTER TABLE DETACH PARTITION
   19478             :  *
   19479             :  * Return the address of the relation that is no longer a partition of rel.
   19480             :  *
   19481             :  * If concurrent mode is requested, we run in two transactions.  A side-
   19482             :  * effect is that this command cannot run in a multi-part ALTER TABLE.
   19483             :  * Currently, that's enforced by the grammar.
   19484             :  *
   19485             :  * The strategy for concurrency is to first modify the partition's
   19486             :  * pg_inherit catalog row to make it visible to everyone that the
   19487             :  * partition is detached, lock the partition against writes, and commit
   19488             :  * the transaction; anyone who requests the partition descriptor from
   19489             :  * that point onwards has to ignore such a partition.  In a second
   19490             :  * transaction, we wait until all transactions that could have seen the
   19491             :  * partition as attached are gone, then we remove the rest of partition
   19492             :  * metadata (pg_inherits and pg_class.relpartbounds).
   19493             :  */
   19494             : static ObjectAddress
   19495         510 : ATExecDetachPartition(List **wqueue, AlteredTableInfo *tab, Relation rel,
   19496             :                       RangeVar *name, bool concurrent)
   19497             : {
   19498             :     Relation    partRel;
   19499             :     ObjectAddress address;
   19500             :     Oid         defaultPartOid;
   19501             : 
   19502             :     /*
   19503             :      * We must lock the default partition, because detaching this partition
   19504             :      * will change its partition constraint.
   19505             :      */
   19506             :     defaultPartOid =
   19507         510 :         get_default_oid_from_partdesc(RelationGetPartitionDesc(rel, true));
   19508         510 :     if (OidIsValid(defaultPartOid))
   19509             :     {
   19510             :         /*
   19511             :          * Concurrent detaching when a default partition exists is not
   19512             :          * supported. The main problem is that the default partition
   19513             :          * constraint would change.  And there's a definitional problem: what
   19514             :          * should happen to the tuples that are being inserted that belong to
   19515             :          * the partition being detached?  Putting them on the partition being
   19516             :          * detached would be wrong, since they'd become "lost" after the
   19517             :          * detaching completes but we cannot put them in the default partition
   19518             :          * either until we alter its partition constraint.
   19519             :          *
   19520             :          * I think we could solve this problem if we effected the constraint
   19521             :          * change before committing the first transaction.  But the lock would
   19522             :          * have to remain AEL and it would cause concurrent query planning to
   19523             :          * be blocked, so changing it that way would be even worse.
   19524             :          */
   19525         106 :         if (concurrent)
   19526          12 :             ereport(ERROR,
   19527             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   19528             :                      errmsg("cannot detach partitions concurrently when a default partition exists")));
   19529          94 :         LockRelationOid(defaultPartOid, AccessExclusiveLock);
   19530             :     }
   19531             : 
   19532             :     /*
   19533             :      * In concurrent mode, the partition is locked with share-update-exclusive
   19534             :      * in the first transaction.  This allows concurrent transactions to be
   19535             :      * doing DML to the partition.
   19536             :      */
   19537         498 :     partRel = table_openrv(name, concurrent ? ShareUpdateExclusiveLock :
   19538             :                            AccessExclusiveLock);
   19539             : 
   19540             :     /*
   19541             :      * Check inheritance conditions and either delete the pg_inherits row (in
   19542             :      * non-concurrent mode) or just set the inhdetachpending flag.
   19543             :      */
   19544         486 :     if (!concurrent)
   19545         340 :         RemoveInheritance(partRel, rel, false);
   19546             :     else
   19547         146 :         MarkInheritDetached(partRel, rel);
   19548             : 
   19549             :     /*
   19550             :      * Ensure that foreign keys still hold after this detach.  This keeps
   19551             :      * locks on the referencing tables, which prevents concurrent transactions
   19552             :      * from adding rows that we wouldn't see.  For this to work in concurrent
   19553             :      * mode, it is critical that the partition appears as no longer attached
   19554             :      * for the RI queries as soon as the first transaction commits.
   19555             :      */
   19556         466 :     ATDetachCheckNoForeignKeyRefs(partRel);
   19557             : 
   19558             :     /*
   19559             :      * Concurrent mode has to work harder; first we add a new constraint to
   19560             :      * the partition that matches the partition constraint.  Then we close our
   19561             :      * existing transaction, and in a new one wait for all processes to catch
   19562             :      * up on the catalog updates we've done so far; at that point we can
   19563             :      * complete the operation.
   19564             :      */
   19565         432 :     if (concurrent)
   19566             :     {
   19567             :         Oid         partrelid,
   19568             :                     parentrelid;
   19569             :         LOCKTAG     tag;
   19570             :         char       *parentrelname;
   19571             :         char       *partrelname;
   19572             : 
   19573             :         /*
   19574             :          * Add a new constraint to the partition being detached, which
   19575             :          * supplants the partition constraint (unless there is one already).
   19576             :          */
   19577         140 :         DetachAddConstraintIfNeeded(wqueue, partRel);
   19578             : 
   19579             :         /*
   19580             :          * We're almost done now; the only traces that remain are the
   19581             :          * pg_inherits tuple and the partition's relpartbounds.  Before we can
   19582             :          * remove those, we need to wait until all transactions that know that
   19583             :          * this is a partition are gone.
   19584             :          */
   19585             : 
   19586             :         /*
   19587             :          * Remember relation OIDs to re-acquire them later; and relation names
   19588             :          * too, for error messages if something is dropped in between.
   19589             :          */
   19590         140 :         partrelid = RelationGetRelid(partRel);
   19591         140 :         parentrelid = RelationGetRelid(rel);
   19592         140 :         parentrelname = MemoryContextStrdup(PortalContext,
   19593         140 :                                             RelationGetRelationName(rel));
   19594         140 :         partrelname = MemoryContextStrdup(PortalContext,
   19595         140 :                                           RelationGetRelationName(partRel));
   19596             : 
   19597             :         /* Invalidate relcache entries for the parent -- must be before close */
   19598         140 :         CacheInvalidateRelcache(rel);
   19599             : 
   19600         140 :         table_close(partRel, NoLock);
   19601         140 :         table_close(rel, NoLock);
   19602         140 :         tab->rel = NULL;
   19603             : 
   19604             :         /* Make updated catalog entry visible */
   19605         140 :         PopActiveSnapshot();
   19606         140 :         CommitTransactionCommand();
   19607             : 
   19608         140 :         StartTransactionCommand();
   19609             : 
   19610             :         /*
   19611             :          * Now wait.  This ensures that all queries that were planned
   19612             :          * including the partition are finished before we remove the rest of
   19613             :          * catalog entries.  We don't need or indeed want to acquire this
   19614             :          * lock, though -- that would block later queries.
   19615             :          *
   19616             :          * We don't need to concern ourselves with waiting for a lock on the
   19617             :          * partition itself, since we will acquire AccessExclusiveLock below.
   19618             :          */
   19619         140 :         SET_LOCKTAG_RELATION(tag, MyDatabaseId, parentrelid);
   19620         140 :         WaitForLockersMultiple(list_make1(&tag), AccessExclusiveLock, false);
   19621             : 
   19622             :         /*
   19623             :          * Now acquire locks in both relations again.  Note they may have been
   19624             :          * removed in the meantime, so care is required.
   19625             :          */
   19626          90 :         rel = try_relation_open(parentrelid, ShareUpdateExclusiveLock);
   19627          90 :         partRel = try_relation_open(partrelid, AccessExclusiveLock);
   19628             : 
   19629             :         /* If the relations aren't there, something bad happened; bail out */
   19630          90 :         if (rel == NULL)
   19631             :         {
   19632           0 :             if (partRel != NULL)    /* shouldn't happen */
   19633           0 :                 elog(WARNING, "dangling partition \"%s\" remains, can't fix",
   19634             :                      partrelname);
   19635           0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   19636             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   19637             :                      errmsg("partitioned table \"%s\" was removed concurrently",
   19638             :                             parentrelname)));
   19639             :         }
   19640          90 :         if (partRel == NULL)
   19641           0 :             ereport(ERROR,
   19642             :                     (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
   19643             :                      errmsg("partition \"%s\" was removed concurrently", partrelname)));
   19644             : 
   19645          90 :         tab->rel = rel;
   19646             :     }
   19647             : 
   19648             :     /* Do the final part of detaching */
   19649         382 :     DetachPartitionFinalize(rel, partRel, concurrent, defaultPartOid);
   19650             : 
   19651         380 :     ObjectAddressSet(address, RelationRelationId, RelationGetRelid(partRel));
   19652             : 
   19653             :     /* keep our lock until commit */
   19654         380 :     table_close(partRel, NoLock);
   19655             : 
   19656         380 :     return address;
   19657             : }
   19658             : 
   19659             : /*
   19660             :  * Second part of ALTER TABLE .. DETACH.
   19661             :  *
   19662             :  * This is separate so that it can be run independently when the second
   19663             :  * transaction of the concurrent algorithm fails (crash or abort).
   19664             :  */
   19665             : static void
   19666         396 : DetachPartitionFinalize(Relation rel, Relation partRel, bool concurrent,

   19898             : /*
   19899             :  * ALTER TABLE ... DETACH PARTITION ... FINALIZE
   19900             :  *
   19901             :  * To use when a DETACH PARTITION command previously did not run to
   19902             :  * completion; this completes the detaching process.
   19903             :  */
   19904             : static ObjectAddress
   19905          14 : ATExecDetachPartitionFinalize(Relation rel, RangeVar *name)
   19906             : {
   19907             :     Relation    partRel;
   19908             :     ObjectAddress address;
   19909          14 :     Snapshot    snap = GetActiveSnapshot();
   19910             : 
   19911          14 :     partRel = table_openrv(name, AccessExclusiveLock);
   19912             : 
   19913             :     /*
   19914             :      * Wait until existing snapshots are gone.  This is important if the
   19915             :      * second transaction of DETACH PARTITION CONCURRENTLY is canceled: the
   19916             :      * user could immediately run DETACH FINALIZE without actually waiting for
   19917             :      * existing transactions.  We must not complete the detach action until
   19918             :      * all such queries are complete (otherwise we would present them with an
   19919             :      * inconsistent view of catalogs).
   19920             :      */
   19921          14 :     WaitForOlderSnapshots(snap->xmin, false);
   19922             : 
   19923          14 :     DetachPartitionFinalize(rel, partRel, true, InvalidOid);
   19924             : 
   19925          14 :     ObjectAddressSet(address, RelationRelationId, RelationGetRelid(partRel));
   19926             : 
   19927          14 :     table_close(partRel, NoLock);
   19928             : 
   19929          14 :     return address;
   19930             : }

   19932             : /*
   19933             :  * DetachAddConstraintIfNeeded
   19934             :  *      Subroutine for ATExecDetachPartition.  Create a constraint that
   19935             :  *      takes the place of the partition constraint, but avoid creating
   19936             :  *      a dupe if an constraint already exists which implies the needed
   19937             :  *      constraint.
   19938             :  */

   19940         140 : DetachAddConstraintIfNeeded(List **wqueue, Relation partRel)
   19941             : {
   19942             :     List       *constraintExpr;
   19943             : 
   19944         140 :     constraintExpr = RelationGetPartitionQual(partRel);

   19947             :     /*
   19948             :      * Avoid adding a new constraint if the needed constraint is implied by an
   19949             :      * existing constraint

   19952             :     {

   19974             : /*
   19975             :  * DropClonedTriggersFromPartition
   19976             :  *      subroutine for ATExecDetachPartition to remove any triggers that were
   19977             :  *      cloned to the partition when it was created-as-partition or attached.
   19978             :  *      This undoes what CloneRowTriggersToPartition did.
   19979             :  */
   19980             : static void
   19981         396 : DropClonedTriggersFromPartition(Oid partitionId)
   19982             : {
   19983             :     ScanKeyData skey;
   19984             :     SysScanDesc scan;
   19985             :     HeapTuple   trigtup;
   19986             :     Relation    tgrel;
   19987             :     ObjectAddresses *objects;
   19988             : 
   19989         396 :     objects = new_object_addresses();
   19990             : 
   19991             :     /*
   19992             :      * Scan pg_trigger to search for all triggers on this rel.
   19993             :      */
   19994         396 :     ScanKeyInit(&skey, Anum_pg_trigger_tgrelid, BTEqualStrategyNumber,
   19995             :                 F_OIDEQ, ObjectIdGetDatum(partitionId));
   19996         396 :     tgrel = table_open(TriggerRelationId, RowExclusiveLock);
   19997         396 :     scan = systable_beginscan(tgrel, TriggerRelidNameIndexId,
   19998             :                               true, NULL, 1, &skey);
   19999         646 :     while (HeapTupleIsValid(trigtup = systable_getnext(scan)))
   20000             :     {
   20001         250 :         Form_pg_trigger pg_trigger = (Form_pg_trigger) GETSTRUCT(trigtup);
   20002             :         ObjectAddress trig;
   20003             : 
   20004             :         /* Ignore triggers that weren't cloned */
   20005         250 :         if (!OidIsValid(pg_trigger->tgparentid))
   20006         232 :             continue;
   20007             : 
   20008             :         /*
   20009             :          * Ignore internal triggers that are implementation objects of foreign
   20010             :          * keys, because these will be detached when the foreign keys
   20011             :          * themselves are.
   20012             :          */

   20015             : 
   20016             :         /*
   20017             :          * This is ugly, but necessary: remove the dependency markings on the
   20018             :          * trigger so that it can be removed.
   20019             :          */

   20021             :                                         TriggerRelationId,

   20030             :     }
   20031             : 
   20032             :     /* make the dependency removal visible to the deletion below */
   20033         396 :     CommandCounterIncrement();
   20034         396 :     performMultipleDeletions(objects, DROP_RESTRICT, PERFORM_DELETION_INTERNAL);
   20035             : 
   20036             :     /* done */
   20037         396 :     free_object_addresses(objects);
   20038         396 :     systable_endscan(scan);
   20039         396 :     table_close(tgrel, RowExclusiveLock);
   20040         396 : }
   20041             : 
   20042             : /*
   20043             :  * Before acquiring lock on an index, acquire the same lock on the owning
   20044             :  * table.
   20045             :  */
   20046             : struct AttachIndexCallbackState
   20047             : {
   20048             :     Oid         partitionOid;
   20049             :     Oid         parentTblOid;
   20050             :     bool        lockedParentTbl;
   20051             : };
   20052             : 
   20053             : static void
   20054         406 : RangeVarCallbackForAttachIndex(const RangeVar *rv, Oid relOid, Oid oldRelOid,
   20055             :                                void *arg)
   20056             : {
   20057             :     struct AttachIndexCallbackState *state;
   20058             :     Form_pg_class classform;
   20059             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   20060             : 
   20061         406 :     state = (struct AttachIndexCallbackState *) arg;
   20062             : 
   20063         406 :     if (!state->lockedParentTbl)
   20064             :     {
   20065         384 :         LockRelationOid(state->parentTblOid, AccessShareLock);
   20066         384 :         state->lockedParentTbl = true;
   20067             :     }

   20104             : /*
   20105             :  * ALTER INDEX i1 ATTACH PARTITION i2
   20106             :  */
   20107             : static ObjectAddress
   20108         384 : ATExecAttachPartitionIdx(List **wqueue, Relation parentIdx, RangeVar *name)
   20109             : {
   20110             :     Relation    partIdx;
   20111             :     Relation    partTbl;
   20112             :     Relation    parentTbl;
   20113             :     ObjectAddress address;
   20114             :     Oid         partIdxId;
   20115             :     Oid         currParent;
   20116             :     struct AttachIndexCallbackState state;
   20117             : 
   20118             :     /*
   20119             :      * We need to obtain lock on the index 'name' to modify it, but we also
   20120             :      * need to read its owning table's tuple descriptor -- so we need to lock
   20121             :      * both.  To avoid deadlocks, obtain lock on the table before doing so on
   20122             :      * the index.  Furthermore, we need to examine the parent table of the
   20123             :      * partition, so lock that one too.
   20124             :      */
   20125         384 :     state.partitionOid = InvalidOid;
   20126         384 :     state.parentTblOid = parentIdx->rd_index->indrelid;

   20133         372 :     if (!OidIsValid(partIdxId))
   20134           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   20135             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_UNDEFINED_OBJECT),

   20137             :

   20286             : /*
   20287             :  * Verify whether the set of attached partition indexes to a parent index on
   20288             :  * a partitioned table is complete.  If it is, mark the parent index valid.
   20289             :  *
   20290             :  * This should be called each time a partition index is attached.
   20291             :  */
   20292             : static void
   20293         336 : validatePartitionedIndex(Relation partedIdx, Relation partedTbl)
   20294             : {
   20295             :     Relation    inheritsRel;

   20303             : 
   20304             :     /*
   20305             :      * Scan pg_inherits for this parent index.  Count each valid index we find
   20306             :      * (verifying the pg_index entry for each), and if we reach the total
   20307             :      * amount we expect, we can mark this parent index as valid.

   20514             : 
   20515             : /*
   20516             :  * resolve column compression specification to compression method.
   20517             :  */
   20518             : static char
   20519      186280 : GetAttributeCompression(Oid atttypid, const char *compression)
   20520             : {
   20521             :     char        cmethod;
   20522             : 
   20523      186280 :     if (compression == NULL || strcmp(compression, "default") == 0)
   20524      186178 :         return InvalidCompressionMethod;
   20525             : 
   20526             :     /*
   20527             :      * To specify a nondefault method, the column data type must be toastable.
   20528             :      * Note this says nothing about whether the column's attstorage setting
   20529             :      * permits compression; we intentionally allow attstorage and
   20530             :      * attcompression to be independent.  But with a non-toastable type,
   20531             :      * attstorage could not be set to a value that would permit compression.
   20532             :      *
   20533             :      * We don't actually need to enforce this, since nothing bad would happen
   20534             :      * if attcompression were non-default; it would never be consulted.  But
   20535             :      * it seems more user-friendly to complain about a certainly-useless
   20536             :      * attempt to set the property.
   20537             :      */
   20538         102 :     if (!TypeIsToastable(atttypid))
   20539           6 :         ereport(ERROR,
   20540             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
   20541             :                  errmsg("column data type %s does not support compression",
   20542             :                         format_type_be(atttypid))));
   20543             : 
   20544          96 :     cmethod = CompressionNameToMethod(compression);
   20545          66 :     if (!CompressionMethodIsValid(cmethod))
   20546          12 :         ereport(ERROR,
   20547             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE),
   20548             :                  errmsg("invalid compression method \"%s\"", compression)));
   20549             : 
   20550          54 :     return cmethod;
   20551             : }
   20552             : 
   20553             : /*
   20554             :  * resolve column storage specification
   20555             :  */
   20556             : static char
   20557         232 : GetAttributeStorage(Oid atttypid, const char *storagemode)
   20558             : {
   20559         232 :     char        cstorage = 0;
   20560             : 
   20561         232 :     if (pg_strcasecmp(storagemode, "plain") == 0)
   20562          48 :         cstorage = TYPSTORAGE_PLAIN;
   20563         184 :     else if (pg_strcasecmp(storagemode, "external") == 0)
   20564         150 :         cstorage = TYPSTORAGE_EXTERNAL;
   20565          34 :     else if (pg_strcasecmp(storagemode, "extended") == 0)
   20566          14 :         cstorage = TYPSTORAGE_EXTENDED;
   20567          20 :     else if (pg_strcasecmp(storagemode, "main") == 0)
   20568          14 :         cstorage = TYPSTORAGE_MAIN;
   20569           6 :     else if (pg_strcasecmp(storagemode, "default") == 0)
   20570           6 :         cstorage = get_typstorage(atttypid);
   20571             :     else

   20573             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE),
   20574             :                  errmsg("invalid storage type \"%s\"",
   20575             :                         storagemode)));

   20578             :      * safety check: do not allow toasted storage modes unless column datatype
